text: Hello. Is there an easy way to create custom emails and use them in workflows? I have spent the last 2 weeks trying to use my own-coded emails and still I’m not able to create a custom email. I tried creating an HTML+HubL template and a Global Module in the Design Manager, but they never appear in the email creation page as part of my templates repository. The template and the module are published.
Go to Marketing > Email > Create Email > Automated. You need to publish an actual email, not just the template - this will include subject, ‘from’ address, etc
Unless I’m misunderstanding and this has already been done
So first I have to create an email and then I’ll be able to add my template?
Yes, once you click Create Email > Automated it will go to a “Select a Template” page - find and choose your template and build out the email that will send
The thing is that the template I created in Design Manager does not appear in when I’m in “Select a Template page”
at the top of the page can you check that you’re in “Custom”?
Yes, I’m there. But nothing shows up, not there nor in “Drag and drop”

I just found a way to add the email I saved as a module in the Design Manager. So I created an email, deleted all modules that come by default and added the module I created. However, the preview and the proofs I sent to my inbox looks really bad.
When you first created the template did you click the Template Type dropdown and change it to Email?
How complex are the emails? Could you just build them out using the drag & drop editor instead of building the HTML template?
Yes, I selected Email for the template. But it didn’t worked and I was advised by support to create a module, not a template. Now in my Design Manager I have both.
Ok just wanted to make sure!
The emails are hand coded, so they are kinda complex. Plus, we plan on creating more complex ones, so we really need an easy to create custom emails in HubSpot
Since you were able to add the module to the email then at least that function worked.

In your design manager, maybe try searching for an email template, clone it, and add the module you need to it? Or download one from the marketplace that looks similar to what you like and add the module and make other adjustments.
It’s just hard to diagnose without really digging into the code
Yes, but because it’s a module and not a template, it removed all the styling I have in my template :disappointed:
The thing is that the module is the whole email template but saved as module. This was the troubleshoot support told me to do so that it would appear in the email creation page.
Ohh sorry I misunderstood
That’s…strange
But there should be a way for the template to appear in the email creation page.
I’m going to DM you!
Updating here in case anyone else has a similar issue: the Template Type was set to Page, not Email

Hi folks :wave-yeti: we want to send an email campaign to our users across different timezones and based on this <https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/email/how-to-send-an-email-based-on-your-contacts-time-zone|guide> we can use only use IP timezone. The problem in our case is that our IP timezone data has an incorrect distribution compared to the country/timezone data in our product database. I'm wondering if we could use our own timezone data for sending emails. Any ideas on how to do it? Thanks in advance :slightly_smiling_face:
